page.title: 01Midsomer Norton & Radstock.
page.content: Norton Radstock lies at the north end of the Mendip Hills and is in the County of Avon.It is 10 miles from Bath and 16 miles from Bristol with a population of approx.18250(1981). The town lies on the River Somer and has always been an important market centre for the surrounding farming country.Coal was discovered at the end of the 18th.C.and the towns became the centre of the Somerset Coalfield.Since the late 1960s,when the pits closed, light industries have been the main employers producing print,shoes,food- packaging and inks.The area is well served with medical and social services,has many different religious groups,is enthusiastic with it's sport and has a sports centre.
